## Subsetting data sets

We subset rows in a dataset using the `filter` command, which loads with `tidyverse`. Let's see this using `penguins`.

```{r}
glimpse(penguins)
```

A set with just adelies:

```{r}
filter(penguins,
       species == "Adelie")
```

```{r}
penguins_sm <- filter(penguins,
                      body_mass_g > 300)
glimpse(penguins_sm)
```

Two conditions at once:

```{r}
penguins_sm <- filter(penguins,
                      body_mass_g > 300,
                      species == "Adelie")
glimpse(penguins_sm)
```

One species or another:

```{r}
penguins_sm <- filter(penguins,
                      species == "Adelie" | 
                        species == "Chinstrap") 
glimpse(penguins_sm)
```
